Use tab to navigate through the menu items. Accessibility Statement for Evans Prairie Country Clubs Website This is an accessibility statement from Evans Prairie Country Club. Conformance status The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) defines requirements for designers and developers to improve accessibility for people with disabilities. It defines three levels of conformance: Level A, Level AA, and Level AAA. Evans Prairie Country Clubs website is fully conformant with WCAG 2.0 level AA. Fully conformant means that the content fully conforms to the accessibility standard without any exceptions. We will continue to make every effort to provide a website in which all functionality and content is accessible to all individuals, and we will continuously monitor and update our site regularly to make it as accessible as possible. ​ Disclaimer Please be aware our efforts to maintain accessibility and usability are ongoing.  While we strive to make the Website as accessible as possible, there may be issues that arise with different assistive technology.  If at any time, you have specific questions or concerns about accessibility of a particular web page on the Website, please contact us by email at guestrelations@ourfmk.com. Thank you for your understanding. ​ Feedback We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of Evans Prairie Country Clubs Website. Please let us know if you encounter accessibility barriers on Evans Prairie Country Clubs Website: Phone: 352-626-5080 E-mail: guestrelations@ourfmk.com Postal Address: PO Box 1227, Wildwood, FL 34785 We try to respond to feedback within 1-2 business days. ​ Date This statement was created on April 10, 2024. Evans Prairie Country Club presents a laid-back yet elegant dining experience with a panoramic view of the charming Evans Prairie. Our restaurant offers a diverse menu of classic American cuisine in an intimate setting. The Villages Hotels Things to Do Restaurants Flights Holiday Homes Travel Stories Cruises Tours Add a Place Travel Forum Airlines Travellers' Choice Help Centre Sunday breakfast buffet - Evans Prairie Country Club United States Florida (FL) Central Florida The Villages The Villages Restaurants Evans Prairie Country Club Search “Sunday breakfast buffet” Review of Evans Prairie Country Club 60 photos Evans Prairie Country Club 1825 Evans Prairie Trl , The Villages, FL 32163-2701 +1 352-750-2225 Website Improve this listing Ranked #32 of 153 Restaurants in The Villages 378 Reviews Price range: $8 - $40 Cuisines: American More restaurant details Restaurant details Dining options: After-hours, Breakfast, Reservations Description: We are a year around Country Club located just off Buena Vista Blvd. Our menu offers appetizers, sandwiches, shrimp and steak dinners as well as some Italian favorites. We have seating for 2 or as many as 100 people at ounce. If you have catering need we are your Country Club. Please stop by after a round of golf or just out with friends. We look forward to serving you soon. KIngTV1 Winter Garden, Florida 181 39 Reviewed 30 November 2015 Sunday breakfast buffet This buffet is relatively new to the area. It offers an made to order omelet and waffle station. There is a hot buffet of scrambled eggs, various breakfast meats, english muffin, potatoes, cheesy grits and oatmeal. There is nice option of fresh fruit. The buffet is situated in the back of restaurant and overlooks a nature area. Date of visit: November 2015 Value Service Food Ask KIngTV1 about Evans Prairie Country Club Thank KIngTV1 This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Read reviews in English Go back 229 - 233 of 378 reviews ladylake1 The Villages, Florida 112 52 Reviewed 25 November 2015 Not consistent. Have been here several times ad found service and quality of food not consistent, When it's good it's great but have had poor service on a couple of visits. Food is usually very good and worth trying out and hoping for a "good" day. Date of visit: November 2015 Ask ladylake1 about Evans Prairie Country Club Thank ladylake1 This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. Sue in reho K Delaware 151 68 Reviewed 6 November 2015 So Not Worth The Wait Hubby and I waited almost 1/2 hour to be seated. Unless this is the first time for every diner, I can't figure out why it was so crowded. I don't know what was worse-the waitress or the food. I don't think I received the drink I ordered but it tasted pretty good so I didn't complain. We waited 20 minutes for any food on the table and finally asked for bread. Bread was flavored with weird spices. Hubby's fish entree was okay. Mine was overcooked and the broccoli was mushy. Never got the extra napkin I requested. There are so many nearby good restaurants. Not going back to this one. Date of visit: October 2015 Value Service Food Ask Sue in reho K about Evans Prairie Country Club Thank Sue in reho K This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. Joyce G The Villages, Florida 1 5 Reviewed 4 November 2015 Horrible experience We had a horrible experience at Evan's Prairie last night. 4 of us were dining and we all ordered salads we were part way done with our salads when suddenly my partner said to stop eating and covers his salad plate with his napkin. He has just found a whole mouse that was dead in his salad. The waitress came over and she was going to take his plate but he followed her and the went direct to the manager. Then the manager came back to our table along with the director of operations and they were apologizing and offered both couples gift cards. Then suddenly the owner of Fresh Made Kitchen who runs Evan's Prairie restaurant came to our table and he also was apologizing and told us that he was going to self report to the Florida Health department. We contacted the Florida Licensing Department this morning they oversee any complaints of this type and we filed a complaint. We also then contacted the Sumpter county Health department just in case they see any food borne illnesses with Evan's Prairie or prepackaged salad as a common denominator. Needless to say we probably won't be returning to Evan's Prairie for a long time if ever. Date of visit: November 2015 Ask Joyce G about Evans Prairie Country Club 5 Thank Joyce G This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. Valarie K Westerville, Ohio 121 33 Reviewed 22 October 2015 Very good food tasty entrees, dinner salad is big enough to share. The lobster mac and cheese was also very good. Portions are decent size. Date of visit: October 2015 Ask Valarie K about Evans Prairie Country Club Thank Valarie K This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC.
